title: Why Is There No Pause Option?
body:
Why is there no pause vote function in this game (asides from Tournament modes)?

So many times a player DC's at the worst time, and it always results in one team taking full advantage as soon as they find out what happened. 

What exploitable advantage can someone get from implementing this?

Could we add if:
- A player disconnects
- Remaining members on team can /pause to vote, all must vote Yes

Even if the game is paused for 1 or 2 minute...That would literally be a blessing.

At least add this for any ranked games...

It is pretty easy to control your concern. Take wrestling for example that has an injury timer. If someone gets injured in any way that isn't a mandatory match stop due to bleeding, the match "pauses" for up to a maximum of 3 minutes before they forfeit.  They could do the same for league with a maximum of a single pause up to 3 minutes long.
Your comparing wrestling and blood pauses to league pauses. Where the blood can be caused from wrestling, needing to take a piss isnt caused by league.

I specifically mentioned an injury timer separate from the blood timer. The reason I specified that is because the match immediately stops if someone is bleeding and a person is given up to 5 minutes to either stop bleeding or cover up whatever is bleeding and I have never seen anyone forfeit due to the blood timer.  Only about 30 seconds is typically used out of the blood timer and it is usually because of bloody noses.  An injury is something that just randomly happens as can be a disconnection in LoL.  I am not opposed to giving someone up to 3 minutes to reconnect by pausing the game.

A disconnection could be detected by the system then, so why do we need the option for it instead of just issuing an auto pause for 1-2 mins when a disconnection occurs. And then having the system limit it as you said before.

In this case...just trying to address disconnection issues. And oh wow...I didn't know pausing a game for 1 minute could give me an exploitable means to win a game...Wow...

I can't believe people would be against the idea of having a pause option in an attempt to provide a means to alleviate player disconnection issues... Wow League community, you've really failed me here. Let's just scrap the suggestion.

I don't know if getting votes from the opposing team is a good idea. They would likely never vote yes to a vote pause.

If a teammate disconnects, you are given the option to open a vote (just for you and the remaining teammembers) to vote for a pause for 1 to 2 minutes.

You can do this to a maximum of 1 or 2 times in a given match.

I don't see how this could possibly hold anyone hostage...
